page.title: 03FARMING
page.content: FARMING _______ The area we studied is a rural farming area.The 12km squares contain over thirty farms and homesteads.The farms vary in size,the largest being 170 acres and the smallest 5 acres.The larger farms are to be found near the mountain slopes where farmers still own the "grazing rights".The larger farms have well over 500 sheep , the smaller ones having between 20 and 30.Dairy farming appears to be on the decline due to the Common Market restrictions.The farms surveyed had a total of 400 acres with an average of 30 cows per farm.All farms surveyed use a proportion (up to 20%)of their land for silage or hay growing.On the domestic side there is an average of 3 sheepdogs and 5 hens per farm.One small farm is now a Riding Centre.
